Keywords: Avengers , Monster , Soldier
Real Name: Steve Rogers
Special Powers
(+5 POINTS) ZOMBIE WITH A PLAN: Zombie Captain America starts the game with the Disney+ #s002 Captain America's Shield equipped.
FOREVER HUNGRY: Steal Energy, Willpower. // When Zombie Captain America hits with a close attack, give him a Food token. // FREE: Remove a Food Token to modify Zombie Captain America's combat values +1 until your next turn.
STILL HOLDING THE SHIELD: Energy Shield/Deflection, Toughness.

Comments
July 8, 2022
Bobcat2022
Used this guy on a Monster squad last night, with his shield trait, and yeah: he just lacks a certain something. Even on a map with lots of walls to cover his approach, he�s just so [I]slow[/I]. The trait Willpower helps, but what he really needs is Sidestep. The Food tokens aren�t as big a pain to keep track of as the Z-Virus pieces of yore, but still a hassle. And his ESD, boosted or otherwise, is like a boss monster's flashing orange weak spot; it�s a priority target for Outwit, and then fire is focused to down him in a turn. I�m glad my play group knows proper zombie protocol (double-tap!), but this piece is going back in the "why bother" box until the next time I need to make a tremendously subtle political point at a July 4th-week event.
June 13, 2022
Oathful
This guy makes for a rather nice tie-up piece. Either your opponent wastes actions dealing with him or he stacks up a Food token or two and starts to put in some work. if you switch his Captain America Shield for US Agents Shield, it makes him that much more annoying to deal with. In Silver Age games, I would put Octopus Arms on him for that Flurry and Food Token stackage, makes him a really good secondary attacker that hits way above his point value. Thematic: 5/10 Viability: 7.5/10 Fun Factor: 8/10, fairly balanced figure
June 3, 2022
rein451
I think you're looking at this piece the wrong way. ESD means you have to get in close to deal w him which is where he wants you. I used him to great effect as a cleanup piece while the rest of my force engaged. He got hit to his last toughness click but was healed back to full by end of game. Only rolled blades w the first attack bc I just used food the rest of the time for +1 stats. Do wish we had more zombies to choose from.
June 1, 2022
Bobcat2022
This figure is how you know WizKids had zero choice in their character selection for this set. Zombie Cap was not that big a deal in the actual "What If... Zombies?" episode--I'd put Zombie Scarlet Witch or Zombie Wasp ahead, easily--but he's here, he's in the Funko Pops, he's in the Hasbro Marvel Legends line, he's in the LEGO blind-bagged minifigures series. Seems to suggest Marvel licensing went out with a list of characters and you could like it or lump it. His dial's okay. Like it better if he had some source of Knockback to go with his ESD, or a second bolt, or Flurry, or something. Can't see myself putting the shield on him even if it were an option; he's already the absolute most points I could see myself paying to include what's here on my force.
May 4, 2022
Goop
Ugg, i HATE ESD on charge pieces. This zombie version also has steal energy so you know your going to have to get right up there to get those food tokens. He's alright but could have been a lot better had they designed him for play rather than thematic.
